predicate.note: Frames file for 'float' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes modes_of_being_with_motion-47.3 roll-51.3.1 run-51.3.2 slide-11.2-1; other framed members include: shake; charge, leap, roll, sneak, walk, wind; halt, roll. Comparison to 'roll' and 'wind'.

roleset.name: not sink in water

example.name: ergative, with LOC
example.text: The second part, consisting of $100 million of senior subordinated floating-rate notes, was priced at 99 3/4 to float 4.25% above the three-month London interbank offered rate.
example.arg: *trace* -> *trace* -> The second part, consisting of $100 million of senior subordinated floating-rate notes
4.25% above the three-month London interbank offered rate

example.name: float as introduce
example.text: One trial balloon *trace-1* Mr. Spiegel is said *trace-2* to have floated *trace-3* to investors: Columbia might be broken up, as Mellon Bank was split into a good bank and a bad bank.

roleset.note: float-as-introduce might be properly pulled out as a separate roleset, but we'll leave them merged for the time being.
